name: tappi
description: Control your browser via Chrome DevTools Protocol. Connects to your existing Chrome — all sessions, cookies, extensions carry over. Pierces shadow DOM. 3-10x fewer tokens than accessibility tree tools.
long_description:
tappi gives AI agents direct browser control through Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP). Instead of dumping massive accessibility trees into context, tappi returns compact indexed element lists — the agent says `click 3` instead of parsing a 50K-token ARIA snapshot.

**Key features:**
- Connects to your existing Chrome — all saved sessions, cookies, and extensions carry over
- Pierces shadow DOM natively (Gmail, Reddit, GitHub all work)
- 23 tools: navigate, click, type, extract text, run JavaScript, upload files, screenshot, and more
- Coordinate commands for cross-origin iframes (captchas, payment forms)
- 3-10x fewer tokens per interaction than accessibility tree tools

**Requirements:** Chrome/Chromium running with `--remote-debugging-port`. Set the CDP_URL config to point to your Chrome instance.

tools.name: tappi_elements
tools.description: List interactive elements (numbered, shadow DOM piercing)

tools.name: tappi_iframe_rect
tools.description: Get iframe bounding box for coordinate targeting

cdp_url.title: Chrome CDP URL
cdp_url.description: URL of your Chrome DevTools Protocol endpoint. Start Chrome with --remote-debugging-port=9222, or use 'tappi launch' to manage profiles.
